page.title: 02ST.JOHN THE BAPTIST'S CHURCH
page.content: St John the Baptist's church was founded in 1258.Probably there was an earlier church on the same site.There are three bells in the tower.One is inscribed "SANCTE GABRIEL ORA PRO NOBIS"(St. Gabriel pray for us.)The second bell was made in 1822.The largest bell is marked "JESUS BE OUR SPED"(Speed).This bell is probably dated between 1539 and 1589.The smallest bell is one of the oldest in Great Britain,there are only three bells like it,one in Scotland one in Lincolnshire and one in{Clarborough}. The parish registers go back to 1567.The church can accommodate 400 people.The churchyard has been used for hundreds of years. The yew tree in the churchyard is believed to be over 1000 years old. There are gargoyles on the walls and the tower.
